intro: Hybanthus serratus f. lorentizianus, commonly known as the Lorentzian hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with serrated leaves and hairy stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
